alert.note: Alert for Caldwell; Comal; Guadalupe; Hays; Travis (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 20 at 10:55PM CDT until April 21 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: The National Weather Service in Austin San Antonio has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Caldwell County in south central Texas... Hays County in south central Texas... Northeastern Guadalupe County in south central Texas... South central Travis County in south central Texas... Eastern Comal County in south central Texas... * Until midnight CDT. * At 1055 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Fischer to near Smithson Valley to Bulverde, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Two inch hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... New Braunfels, San Marcos, Kyle, Seguin, Buda, Lockhart, Wimberley, Canyon Lake Dam, Canyon Lake, Bulverde, Woodcreek, Martindale, Uhland, Mustang Ridge, Kingsbury, Niederwald, Staples, Smithson Valley, Fentress and Fischer. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Large hail, damaging winds, and continuous cloud to ground lightning are occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
